name: rrhfe
body: |- wi(wcel(c0, crrext), wf(cfv(crrh, c0), cr, c1))

stmt.origin: rrhf(c0, c1, cres(cfv(cds, c0), cxp(c1, c1)), cfv(ctg, crn(cioo)), cfv(ctopn, c0), cfv(czlm, c0), wcel(c0, crrext))

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, crrext), wf(cfv(crrh, c0), cr, c1))
-| wceq(cres(cfv(cds, c0), cxp(c1, c1)), cres(cfv(cds, c0), cxp(c1, c1)))
-| wceq(cfv(ctg, crn(cioo)), cfv(ctg, crn(cioo)))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(cbs, c0))
-| wceq(cfv(ctopn, c0), cfv(ctopn, c0))
-| wceq(cfv(czlm, c0), cfv(czlm, c0))
-| wi(wcel(c0, crrext), wcel(c0, cdr))

-| wi(wcel(c0, crrext), wceq(cfv(cuss, c0), cfv(cmetu, cres(cfv(cds, c0), cxp(c1, c1)))))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ RRExt →((RRHom ` c0): ℝ → c1))
⊣ ((dist ` c0)|`(c1 × c1))=((dist ` c0)|`(c1 × c1))
⊣ (topGen ` ran((,)))=(topGen ` ran((,)))
⊣ c1 =(Base ` c0)
⊣ (TopOpen ` c0)=(TopOpen ` c0)
⊣ (ZMod ` c0)=(ZMod ` c0)
⊣ (c0 ∈ RRExt → c0 ∈ DivRing)
⊣ (c0 ∈ RRExt → c0 ∈ NrmRing)
⊣ (c0 ∈ RRExt →(ZMod ` c0)∈ NrmMod)
⊣ (c0 ∈ RRExt →(chr ` c0)= 0)
⊣ (c0 ∈ RRExt → c0 ∈ CUnifSp)
⊣ (c0 ∈ RRExt →(UnifSt ` c0)=(metUnif `((dist ` c0)|`(c1 × c1))))

comment: If ` R ` is an extension of ` RR ` , then the canonical homomorphism of ` RR ` into ` R ` is a function. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 2-May-2018.)
